jrigby.openstack_queue.server

Class ResourceRequest

  • java.lang.Object
    • jrigby.openstack_queue.server.ResourceRequest
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    ThreeStageJobResourceRequest

    public class ResourceRequest
extends java.lang.Object
    Specifies a job to execute that is submitted to a ResourceQueue.
    Author:
    jason

    • Constructor Detail

      • ResourceRequest

        public ResourceRequest(java.lang.String serverGroupName,
               ResourceProvisioningCallback callback)
        Initialises the request with default values, most of which are defined in a configuration file.
        Parameters:
        serverGroupName - the name given to the group of servers (aka job name)
        callback - called once servers allocation completes or fails.
        See Also:
        ServerSettings

    • Method Detail

      • doSuccess

        public void doSuccess(ServerCollection nodes)
        Triggers the ResourceProvisioningCallback.onSuccess(ServerCollection) method.
        Parameters:
        nodes - allocated nodes

      • doFailure

        public boolean doFailure(java.lang.Throwable e)
        Triggers the ResourceProvisioningCallback.onFailure(Throwable) method.
        Parameters:
        e - the exception that resulted from the failure
        Returns:
        true if the job is to be rescheduled, false if not

      • getMinNodes

        public int getMinNodes()
        Gets the minimum number of acceptable nodes
        Returns:
        minimum acceptable nodes

      • setMinNodes

        public void setMinNodes(int minNodes)
        Sets the minimum number of nodes required. If this is greater than the current value of maxNodes, then maxNodes is set to the same value as minNodes.
        Parameters:
        minNodes - minimum nodes required

      • getMaxNodes

        public int getMaxNodes()
        Gets the maximum number of acceptable nodes. This is the target of the ResourceQueue.
        Returns:
        maximum acceptable nodes

      • setMaxNodes

        public void setMaxNodes(int maxNodes)
        Set the maximum number of nodes required. If maxNodes is less than this number, then minNodes is set to the same value as MaxNodes.
        Parameters:
        maxNodes - maximum nodes required

      • getMinNodeSize

        public int getMinNodeSize()
        Get the minimum node size
        Returns:
        smallest number of CPUs acceptable

      • setMinNodeSize

        public void setMinNodeSize(int minNodeSize)
        Sets the minimum node size
        Parameters:
        minNodeSize - smallest number of CPUs acceptable

        Parameters:

      • getPreferredAvailabilityZones

      • getGroupName

        public java.lang.String getGroupName()
        Gets the group name of this request (aka job name). It is used as the prefix for servers created for this request.
        Returns:
        the server group name

      • setGroupName

        public void setGroupName(java.lang.String groupName)
        Sets the server group name for this request (aka job name). It is used as the prefix for servers created for this request.
        Parameters:
        groupName - the server group name

      • getId

        public int getId()
        Gets the request ID. This is set automatically by incrementing a static counter when the object is instantiated. It is not a persistent value and will reset when the application is restarted.
        Returns:
        the request ID
